newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Budget Committee wants to freeze fund for DG 10.
newsitem.headline: Budget Committee wants to freeze fund for DG 10.

text.p: The President of the European Parliament's Budget Committee, Detlev Samland, wants the Parliament to freeze one half of the 1997 budget for DG 10, the directorate general responsible for information policy.
Samland told reporters this week he considered the directorate to be inefficient and said it should be restructured as an information agency.
The first reading of the budget will take place at the Parliament's plenary session in Strasbourg in two weeks' time.
The frozen money would amount to more than 20 million Ecus, he said.
EU officials said Oreja was informed of the budget committee's discontent at a closed-door meeting two weeks ago.

Director General of the DG Colette Flesch has been given the task of finding a way of meeting the committee's concerns before she leaves her post to head the Commission's translation service at the end of the year.
